snippet: The Mets scored four runs in the seventh inning and, for the second night in a row, staged a late rally to defeat the Phillies.
abstract: New York Mets defeat Philadelphia Phillies, 7-4. Photos (M)
lead_paragraph: PHILADELPHIA -- The flags in center field at Citizens Bank Park note that the Phillies are the five-time defending National League East champions, with a set of starting arms unequaled in baseball, on display in a ballpark that has sold out 216 consecutive games. It is taking a lot to keep reminding the Phillies of all that, though. Certainly the first fifth of this season has not been nearly as much fun for Philadelphia as it has been for the Mets.

headline.main: Mets Turn Tables and Take Advantage of the Phillies' Beleaguered Bullpen
